content: You should keep in mind that every other test case is a validator which will be used to evaluate the solutions and won't be visible to players. This is important because currently there is no validator for the tricky case where a letter in the word to be guessed appears multiple times in the guess (tests "Some displaced characters" and "Two for one"). I would suggest adding a couple more tests and making each test similar to (but not the exact same as) its corresponding validator.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: C'est en accord avec ce qu'on voit actuellement comme jeu !!
Testé en Python pour ma part

I agree that this isn't ideal for reverse mode and that you shouldn't use the [[ ]] formatting so abundantly. It shouldn't be used for constants.
Same in your constraints, don't put the whole |w| = |g| line in yellow.

Moreover, regarding the constraints, it would be nice to specify the boundaries of the strings' lengths. Just for completeness.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle

Nice puzzle
Agree that it isn't good for reverse and that formatting mentioned by FoXbOw should be fixed

Sorry to say, but I don't think it's good for reverse.

First, validators should be similar to tests, but you have different topics on each test and validator(especially on the topic TWO FOR ONE).

Second, the description won't show when in reverse mode. So maybe we'll don't know what variable w and g stand for.

Still, this is a good question and fun topic, just not so great for reverse.

the [[ x ]] format is for variable
maybe you can use << bold >> instead for X / _
